revised_title: On the Magnetic Rotation of the Plane of Polarization of Light in Liquids: Part I - Carbon Bisulfide and Water
tldr: The authors investigate the magnetic rotation of the plane of polarization of light in liquids, focusing on carbon bisulfide and water. They discuss the effects of temperature on the rotation and compare their findings with previous studies, concluding that their results provide a more accurate representation of the true temperature variation of the rotation in carbon bisulfide.
